alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern York , the City of Poquoson, the northwestern City of Norfolk, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Northampton, or near Christopher Newport University, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Christopher Newport University around 410 PM EDT. Portsmouth and Beaconsdale around 420 PM EDT. Northampton around 425 PM EDT. Hampton University around 435 PM EDT. Hampton, Langley AFB and Fort Monroe around 440 PM EDT. Buckroe Beach and Grand View around 445 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Fox Hill, Phoebus, Langley View, Messick, Hilton Village, Willoughby Spit, Plum Tree Island Refuge and Raleigh Terrace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; York
